nodes.bodyText: Maybe move this as default in switch?
Ther should be 1 statement per line. Please break it into separate statements. Coalescing complex code into gigantic nested statements make it very difficult to read and debug.

Please consider extractin this interface into a fragment member. Those callbacks are de facto piece of fragment logic and here are mixed with construction logic.
Alternatively we could create 2 methods in fragment and link them here.
Please consider eliminating magic values and moveing them to documented constants.
Those are the values from the resource array.. I'm not sure whether it's considered bad practice to use getResources().getTextArray(R.array.pref_name_collision_policy_entryValues) in non-UI classes
No sure why do we pass a primitive type instead of strongly typed enum here?

nodes.bodyText:
Please provide a javadoc for this method. The name does not tell the story. Why do we convert it to int? What is the meaning of this int? Constraints?
Please consider using primitive type instead of boxed type.

Can we use the same names as in the enum? That makes it possible to use NameCollisionPolicy.valueOf() directly.
@tobiasKaminsky Given that the type has been probably misnamed, if we want to fix it it's time to do it here instead of spilling this confusing name everywhere.

I actually don't see that this name is too wrong... because it's an enum of policies on what to do if a collision of filenames happens... so NameCollisionPolicy is the noun of it..
I also thought about eliminating this array but as NameCollisionPolicy contains CANCEL as well, it is not as easily usable in the UI code..
As a reminder the options in the enum are:

RENAME,
OVERWRITE,
CANCEL,
ASK_USER;

while the options that were to be added are:

Ask everytime
Overwrite
Rename
@ezaquarii are you fine with the current version for now?
